page.title: 01LAND N.E. OF GANTON
page.content: An area of fertile farmland on vale of Pickering, very flat, originally post glacial Lake Pickering. Fields cultivated for sugar beet, wheat, potatoes, kale and turnips for sheep grazing. almost a Dutch landscape with deep drains and water courses. The Ganton Golf Club is famous and has been the venue for championship matches. Quite a few shelter belts in this block. Ganton Hall stands in south west corner where the low hills of the Yorkshire Wolds begin to rise. The main railway from Malton to Scarborough bisects the block and the main road A64 leeds to Scarborough diagonnally cuts across south west corner through Ganton Village. The long distance walk "Wolds Way" traverses south western corner.
